1.text: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? dost thou mark the calving of the hinds?

2.text: Dost thou number the months that they fulfil? and knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

3.text: They bow themselves, they give birth to their young ones, they cast out their pains;

4.text: Their young ones become strong, they grow up in the open field, they go forth, and return not unto them.

5.text: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? and who hath loosed the bands of the onager,

6.text: Whose house I made the wilderness, and the salt plain his dwellings?

7.text: He laugheth at the tumult of the city, and heareth not the shouts of the driver;

8.text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

9.text: Will the buffalo be willing to serve thee, or will he lodge by thy crib?

10.text: Canst thou bind the buffalo with his cord in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

11.text: Wilt thou put confidence in him, because his strength is great? and wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

12.text: Wilt thou trust him to bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy threshing-floor?

13.text: The wing of the ostrich beats joyously—But is it the stork’s pinion and plumage?

14.text: For she leaveth her eggs to the earth, and warmeth them in the dust,

15.text: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the beast of the field may trample them.

16.text: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers; her labour is in vain, without her concern.

17.text: For +God hath deprived her of wisdom, and hath not furnished her with understanding.

18.text: What time she lasheth herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

19.text: Hast thou given strength to the horse? hast thou clothed his neck with the quivering mane?

20.text: Dost thou make him to leap as a locust? His majestic snorting is terrible.

21.text: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in [his] strength; he goeth forth to meet the armed host.

22.text: He laugheth at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from before the sword.

23.text: The quiver rattleth upon him, the glittering spear and the javelin.

24.text: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage, and cannot contain himself at the sound of the trumpet:

25.text: At the noise of the trumpets he saith, Aha! and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

26.text: Doth the hawk fly by thine intelligence, [and] stretch his wings toward the south?

27.text: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make his nest on high?

28.text: He inhabiteth the rock and maketh his dwelling on the point of the cliff, and the fastness:

29.text: From thence he spieth out the prey, his eyes look into the distance;

30.text: And his young ones suck up blood; and where the slain are, there is he.
